result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Q Newby-Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
If revoked, court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election utnil his civil rights are restored.

No drugs or alcohol.
No affiliation with known gang members.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund
2/5/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Maurice Q Newby-Ferguson in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 60 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Court order 50 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
* No affiliation with known gang members.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Maurice Q Newby-Ferguson in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Maurice Q Newby-Ferguson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
